citations.narrative:
Four rabbit enclosures are used to house 5 of the exhibition rabbits. The largest enclosure, housing two rabbits in a
separate room, had an accumulation of feces on the floors of both levels of the enclosure. Two of the three other
enclosures had a severe accumulation of dried feces on the absorbent blankets on the floors. Due to these severe
accumulations of dried feces, it was evident that the enclosures have not been cleaned on a periodic basis. Although the
two other rabbits are not currently housed in the two affected enclosures, it is still necessary to remove excreta from the
blankets and floors for the health and well-being of the other rabbit, housed in a separate enclosure, in the same room.
Primary enclosures shall be kept reasonably free of excreta by periodic cleaning for the health, comfort and well-being of
the rabbits housed therein.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 1, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
End Section

narrative:
3.56(a)(1) 
   
Sanitation. 
Four rabbit enclosures are used to house 5 of the exhibition rabbits.  The largest enclosure, housing two rabbits in a 
separate room, had an accumulation of feces on the floors of both levels of the enclosure.  Two of the three other 
enclosures had a severe accumulation of dried feces on the absorbent blankets on the floors.  Due to these severe 
accumulations of dried feces, it was evident that the enclosures have not been cleaned on a periodic basis.  Although the 
two other rabbits are not currently housed in the two affected enclosures, it is still necessary to remove excreta from the 
blankets and floors for the health and well-being of the other rabbit, housed in a separate enclosure, in the same room. 
 
 Primary enclosures shall be kept reasonably free of excreta by periodic cleaning for the health, comfort and well-being of 
the rabbits housed therein. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class  “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by May 1, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.

Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
End Section
